page.title: 01The Port of Deal, Kent
page.content: The area is predominantly coastal with older style properties and enclosed rough pasture land for grazing. Many of the houses were originally used by sailors when the port of Deal was a thriving community. these dwelling places have now been converted into private residential homes, flats and small owner occupied properties. the main shopping area comprises of single shops with traditional frontages. The Royal Cinque Ports Golf Club occupies a large proportion of the land area. It follows the contours of the coast and is a links golf course. Sandown Castle is an ancient ruin which was part of the Tudor fortifications. There is very little of this site remaining. The pasture land comprises of marsh land, rough grazing and enclosed grazing areas for sheep and cattle.
